bibl.title: Letter from Laura Grace Jackson to Howard A. Kelly, July 14, 1907

div1.p: Jackson sends a contribution for Kissinger. Her husband knew Kissinger as a hospital attendant.

div1.head: Letter from Laura Grace Jackson to Howard A. Kelly, July 14, 1907
div1.opener:
Valleceto, Calaveros Co.
Calif. July 14 1907.
ans
Mr. Howard A. Kelly
1418 Eutaw Place
Baltimore, Md.
Dear Sir:-
div1.p:
Enclosed please find check for
ten dollars which my husband & I
gratefully send for the use of John
Kissinger. He was hospital attendant
when Mr. Jackson who was then
lieutenant of artillery, regular army,
had typhoid and we were both
very much attached to him.
Could you send me copies of the
letter which appeared in the Outlook
stating his case and I will try to have
other sums sent you?

closer.signed:
Laura Grace Jackson
(Mrs Harry Frederick Jackson)
